views.markdown:
Compatible with iOS 11, 12 and 13

1. A Control Center toggle for turning SSH server on/off.
2. A Settings menu for changing the port that OpenSSH listens on, and whether root login is allowed.
Add the toggle to ControlCenter from Settings > Control Center > Customize Controls.

Whether the SSH server stays off or starts up after rebooting/re-jailbreaking, can be changed in the OpenSSH Settings.

When turning sshd off, active sessions get disconnected. This functionality can be turned off in the Settings.

For the ones loving the shell, it also includes the command SSHswitch which has the same functionalities, `SSHswitch -h` describes its options. No need to log in as root for it to work.

blanxd

* Added support for Checkra1n and iOS 13. CHANGES 1.3.3
* Added the ability to change the port(s) if ssh server is not running as sshd daemon, but via launchd listener (ie. compatibility with unc0ver).


CHANGES 1.3.2
* Incoming scp and sftp connections now also get disconnected when turning sshd off (unless allowed to persist, in the Settings).
* Internal optimizations, not dependent on coreutils any more.
CHANGES v.1.3.1
* Enabled specifying several ports for sshd to listen on.
* Internal stability fixes (none reported, but in theory v.1.3 was able to crash a few things).


CHANGES v.1.3
* Added options to control whether sshd starts (or doesn't) after rebooting/re-jailbreaking, despite the running toggled state. In the Settings.
* Long-press on the CC toggle now takes straight to the OpenSSH Settings (not from the LockScreen).
* Turning the SSH server on/off from the CC on the Lock Screen in the locked state is now disabled (it can be enabled in the OpenSSH Settings if needed).
* Fixed a bug that made the toggle disappear from the CC for a few users (I apologize for that, indeed).

* Added option to OpenSSH Settings to disallow root logins.
* Fixed icon and module label in CC Settings.
